intro: Psilotrichum gnaphalobryum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed spikemoss, is a member of the family Psilotaceae and is characterized by its unique morphology. It is a small, herbaceous plant with a creeping stem that produces erect, spore-bearing cones. The plant has reduced leaves and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures are simple and consist of sporophylls that enclose the spores. Psilotrichum gnaphalobryum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
